_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

This electronic EPA RMP was prepared in accordance with the requirements of the Clean Air Act 112 (r) as codified by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency at 40 CFR Part 68. Standards codified by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration at 29 CFR 1910.119 are not applicable to the operations at this facility because the facility is operated as a retail operation and is exempt from the OSHA standards. However, the OSHA standards at 29 CFR 1910.111, Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, are applicable and are included in the Risk Management Program (RMPr) document that is implemented by this Facility. This electronic RMP summarizes the policies and procedures implemented by the Facility to minimize the likelihood of an accident. The electronic RMP also summarizes the actions that the Facility has taken to ensure that a response to a release will be implemented in a proper and timely manner.

PURPOSE FOR UPDATING RMP

The Facility is submitting this to satisfy the 5-year registration requirements. Applicable sections of the Facility RMPr have been updated.

FACILITY

The operations at this Facility consist of agricultural fertilizer retail sale and distribution. The Facility operates one (1) covered process that includes Storage and Handling of anhydrous ammonia at quantities that exceed the regulatory threshold quantity. Anhydrous ammonia is transported to this Facility by a third party owned and operated cargo truck. The cargo truck Operator transfers anhydrous ammonia from the cargo truck to two (2) 30,000-gallon stationary pressure vessel (PV).

The Facility stores the anhydrous ammonia and then transfers the anhydrous ammonia from the PV to nurse tanks at the point of retail sale to the end user (i.e. Grower/Farmer). Trained Process Operators perform the transfer of anhydrous ammonia in accordance with its RMPr accident prevention program.

ACCIDENT PREVENTION PROGRAM

The Operations Manager implements the risk management planni

ng process at this Facility. The Operations Manager is assisted by other Facility staff, as directed. The Operations Manager is responsible for ensuring that Facility Staff are properly trained in the implementation of the Prevention Program which includes Safety Information, Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Maintenance, Compliance Audits, Incident Investigations, and Emergency Contingency Plans.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

This is a non-responding Facility. The Facility has coordinated emergency response activities with its local emergency response agency and local fire department.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no on-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage; or off-site deaths, injuries, property damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place, in the past five (5) years because of the ammonia operations at this Facility.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

The Facility will address each recommendation listed in the process hazard analysis (PHA). In summary, the PHA recommendations include, but are not limited to:

	Replace hydrostatic relief valves that are expired and/or are rated greater than the process MAWP.
	Paint and/or label all nurse tank valves.
	Replace the emergency shutdown signs that are no longer legible.
	Perform emergency notification with response agencies.
Update the Facility RMP program to reflect the EPA RMP rule changes published on May 2024.


CONCLUSION

The Risk Management Plan implemented by the Facility complies with the requirements of the Clean Air Act, Section 112(r). The RMP will be updated as the Facility adds, deletes, or makes changes to the process.
NOTE: Sections 4, 5, 6, and 7 of the standard RMP produced by EPA's RMP Submit Program are not applicable to the Facility.
